heading: Abstract
text: Hemoproteins able catalyze extraordinarily broad range reactions. class proteins includes cytochrome P450s peroxidases, among many others. Hemoproteins definition include heme achieve chemistry; heme molecules vary considerably, different heme molecules employed depending function particular hemoprotein. present, knowledge gap literature structural features required bind heme hemoprotein binding sites.study, investigated binding environments heme-b, heme-c, siroheme, verdoheme. high-throughput framework developed generate, process, analyze data derived Protein Data Bank (PDB) files used study. Amino acid frequencies, volume, surface areas, angular relations within heme binding sites obtained examined diverse set hemoproteins. Overall, find nonpolar residues interactions heme may greater importance heme binding previously thought, suggesting polar interactions, necessary, insufficient efficiently bind heme. also report several values binding pocket volumes, surface areas, angular data may utility artificial metalloenzyme design. framework developed study highly adaptable may facilitate similar investigations proteins ligands.

heading: Introduction
text: Proteins contain metal ion cofactor(s) known metalloproteins, compose approximately 40% proteins. metal ion can free, complexed another molecule. One molecule heme, complex iron porphyrin ring. Heme employed many metalloproteins catalyze broad range reactions(Poulos2014?).many types heme; coordination complex composed iron atom coordinated bound modified porphyrin ring. Porphyins composed four pyrrole subunits (pentagonal structures four carbons nitrogen) bound together via methine (.e. carbon) bridges. Porphyrins considered macrocycles, molecules large ring structures. ring within porphyrins heterocyclic, considered aromatic, therefore acts large resonant structure capable transferring electrons. Coupled iron atom enable reduction-oxidation reactions macrocycle porphyrin ring, overall heme complex therefore highly suited reactions involving electron transfer(Kleingardner Bren 2015).Proteins containing heme known hemoproteins - hemoglobin myoglobin well-known examples, using heme store transport oxygen. examples hemoproteins peroxidases, catalases (type peroxidase), nitric oxide synthases, heme oxygenases, cytochrome p450s. Peroxidases catalases catalyze oxidation-reduction reactions using histidine-bound heme, catalases particular specializing decomposition hydrogen peroxide. Nitric oxide synthases catalyze reaction L-arginine nitric oxide, vitally important cellular signaling (Poulos2014?). Free heme molecules may released upon degradation hemoproteins (especially hemoglobin), however, heme prooxidative therefore toxic cells must cleared. Heme oxygenases assist degradation heme, regarded potential therapeutics, due anti-inflammatory effects(Araujo2012?).enzymes arguably potential applications, cytochrome P450s function powerful monooxygenases. participate many reactions: capable oxidizing wide range substrates, including carbohydrates, steroids, fatty acids; catalyzing hormone degradation synthesis; degrading majority drugs(Poulos2014?). Due extraordinary utility range reactions, cytochrome p450s great interest protein engineering field. Cytochrome P450s potential used industrial biocatalysis, e.g. pharmaceutical production, bioremediation environmental pollutants(Du2017?; Lalonde 2016). limiting factor preventing deployment struggle increase enzymatic efficiency therefore yield processes employing enzyme(Girvan2016?; Li2020?).Thus far, heme-b respective hemoproteins discussed (although heme-b abundant employed type heme). types heme structurally chemically different, used achieve different chemical reactions. study, examined heme-b, heme-c, verdoheme, siroheme. structures shown Figures 1-5, heme individually discussed .

heading: 1.2 Pre-processing
text: Many PDBs downloaded multimeric structures. number subunits per protein skew results overrepresent especially large multimeric proteins. Therefore, allow one heme binding site per PDB, downloaded PDBs converted monomeric structures. achieved saving single chain (chain ) PDB eliminating chains. single chain saved PDB used subsequent scripts. Part script reproduced :
code:
from chimera import runCommand as rc
# select chain A, a single unit
rc("sel :.a")
# select everything else
rc("sel invert sel")
# delete everything else besides that chain A
rc("del sel")
# now save the monomer:
rc(("write format pdb 0 "+unexpandedResultPath+activeLigand+"/%s")%
  (fn + ".mono.pdb"))

heading: 1.3.2 Volume Calculations
text:
Volume binding pocket predicted via Surfnet (Laskowski1995?), run default parameters Grid Interval = 1.0 Distance Cutoff = 10.0 (latter option relate distance cutoff ligand). Surfnet molecular volume calculation tool implemented within UCSF Chimera. script used selects residues around heme consider bounds pocket, effectively ignores heme’s presence calculates volume, pocket empty:Surfnet, least investigation, prone generating small volumes. analysis removed largest volume generated recorded, since largest volume generated identified likely binding pocket. Two figures demonstrate run one good pocket produced, one small “bubbles” generated:
Figure 1.1: Good Example Surfnet Run (1B2V)

Figure 1.2: Non-Ideal Example Surfnet Run (1DKH)
code:
from chimera import runCommand as rc
# Select the atoms within 7A of heme. 
#Then, of that selection, keep everything but heme.
rc("sel :"+activeLigand+" za < "+angstromDistance)
# this is the syntax that accomplishes our desired selection
rc("sel sel &~:"+activeLigand) 
interface_surfnet("sel","sel")
rc("sop split #") # acquire the individual pockets that have been generated
rc("measure volume #") # measures volume of individual pockets
# in R we keep only the largest volume

text: Solvent excluded solvent accessible surface areas ligand binding pocket calculated using Chimera’s “surf” algorithm, implementation program called MSMS (Sanner1996?).two measures similar . Solvent accessible surface area represents surface area protein solvent molecule (.e. water) may interact . calculated rolling sphere Van der Waals surface protein, center sphere recorded bounds accessible surface area. Solvent excluded surface area calculated way, rolling sphere Van der Waals surface protein, instead point contact sphere Van der Waals surface recorded excluded surface area. solvent excluded surface area may therefore considered bounds protein , versus solvent accessible surface area, can considered bounds solvent may interact protein(Sanner1996?).

heading: 1.3.4 Distance Calculations
text: Distances amino acids ligand calculated accurately precisely direct way. Instead, distances atom composing residue calculated. achieved using built-function chimera; syntax straightforward, part script shown . distances atoms within residue averaged, value taken mean distance entire residue used subsequent steps.data produced step therefore include mean distance amino acid. Distances traceable per residue atoms residue; data used construct distributions amino acids distance, angular data cross-referenced list distances.
code:
from chimera import runCommand as rc
#select and define the Fe atom
rc("sel :HEM@Fe") 
# index to acquire the one atom selected
fe = chimera.selection.currentAtoms()[0] 
# select all atoms within angstromDistance of Fe (also de-selects Fe)
rc("sel sel za < "+settings.angstromDistance) 
# define this selection of atoms within distance as a list
nearbyAtoms = chimera.selection.currentAtoms()
# parse and print the distances (and coordinates) of these atoms 
for i in nearbyAtoms:
  print "Atom being analyzed...", i, "... Distance to Fe...",
  #prints distance between atom i and the Fe atom
  i.coord().distance(fe.coord())
